title: Fan, 1895–1905
medium: Medium: etched paper with hand coloring (mount); lacquer on bamboo wood (sticks)
description: Pleated fan with rectangular leaf. Leaf of hand-colored etching on paper; sticks of painted bamboo. The print shows the Arch of Triumph in Canton, China. Ernest Kees, a Paris fan-maker of the late 18th and early 20th century, popularized the square-shaped leaf.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fan, 1895–1905.
1895–1905. Medium: etched paper with hand coloring (mount); lacquer on bamboo wood (sticks). Bequest of Sarah Cooper Hewitt. 1931-6-123.
